data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3266514,"name":"Joshua Epperson","username":"jepperson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/74df32/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-12-18T06:37:47.734Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eMy team is making our custom swerve drive and we have been prototyping with plastic versions of our parts that will be machined out of metal, but something we’ve noticed is that the magnets tend to skip. We’re gonna apply superglue to prevent this but it made me wonder, since we are going to be machining our magnet holders out of stainless steel (it’s a machined hex bolt), couldn’t the magnetic property of the shaft prevent rotation that way not require the use of superglue? Also would not using aluminum cause us trouble in regards to the encoder sensing it properly? We are using the thrifty bot encoder.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-12-18T06:37:47.734Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":63,"reads":296,"readers_count":295,"score":374.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":446500,"topic_slug":"question-about-swerve-magnet-retention","display_username":"Joshua Epperson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49514,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/question-about-swerve-magnet-retention/446500/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3266517,"name":"","username":"beter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/beter/{size}/152479_2.png","created_at":"2023-12-18T07:34:40.410Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eSome of the most common alloys stainless steels, like 304 and 316 are not magnetic by default, so they shouldn’t interfere with your magnet sensing. Even then I would still recommend you machine it out of aluminum if at all possible because stainless can be hard to machine at times and will be heavier than aluminum.\u003cbr\u003e\nAs for retaining the magnet super glue works fine, most teams use either super glue or green Loctite (Loctite 609 if I remember off the top of my head).\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-12-18T07:34:40.410Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":283,"readers_count":282,"score":66.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":446500,"topic_slug":"question-about-swerve-magnet-retention","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":47788,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"worm kid"},"post_url":"/t/question-about-swerve-magnet-retention/446500/2","custom_user_title":"worm kid","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3266573,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2023-12-18T17:01:18.313Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eThe sensors can be affected by anything which distorts the magnetic field from the magnet, so you want to be pretty careful here.  Maybe a slight amount of distortion will be OK, and maybe your stainless won’t do this (even operations like machining can have an impact in this area).  But not using stainless here means you don’t have to worry about it.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSee: \u003ca href=\"https://www.meadmetals.com/blog/why-is-stainless-steel-not-magnetic\" class=\"inline-onebox\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eWhy is Stainless Steel Not
